intro: Phacellaria wattii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved phacellaria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slightly hairy texture. Phacellaria wattii produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months, contributing to its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
